title: Eliminate a Variable
text: Elimintate the x's by multiplying the second equation by 3. $$-3x+y=-9$$ $$3\left(x-2y\right)=3\left(-12\right)$$

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. x will be eliminated and then solve for y. $$-5y=-45$$ $$y=9$$

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text: Substitute $$y=9$$ into the first equation, $$-3x+y=-9$$. Then solve for x. $$-3x+y=-9$$ $$-3x+9=-9$$ $$-3x=-18$$ $$x=6$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is (6,9).
